18.35.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Hello I'm
Sheryl McCarthy of the City

20.09.text:
University of New York.
Welcome to One to One.

23.79.text:
I'm delighted to welcome Erica
Jong back to the program.

27.66.text:
More than 40 years ago she
stunned us with her novel

30.66.text:
Fear of Flying which showed
that women have the ability

34.00.text:
to control their own sexual
destinies and sold more than

37.80.text:
27 million copies. In her new
novel we meet Vanessa

42.21.text:
Wondermen who is in her 60s
and has some of the same

45.81.text:
needs and desires that
Isadora Wing had, but she

49.28.text:
also has more daunting
responsibilities, discovers

52.49.text:
the surprising limitations
that come with aging and

56.02.text:
hovering over it all is the
fear of death. How will she

59.69.text:
cope and will she be as
fearless as Isadora Wing was?

64.40.text:
Fear of Dying has just been
published by

70.80.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: So what
was the impetus for the book.

73.81.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: God I think it
was very, very hard to write.

78.31.text:
I tried for many years to
write Isadora Wing at 60 and

83.62.text:
I couldn't because Isadora
Wing had so much baggage from

88.12.text:
readers, from me and there
was such a sense of

91.83.text:
expectation. So one day I
start writing in the voice of

97.40.text:
an older actress, Vanessa
Wondermen and it's funny and

102.20.text:
it's quirky and she's about
to go on the Internet in

105.74.text:
search of lovers. She goes to
a site called zipless.com

110.78.text:
which doesn't exist of course
I invented it and she's

115.35.text:
trying to find a lover. And
she meets a selection of

122.16.text:
crazies like you wouldn't
believe. So it's really in a

125.76.text:
way the book begins with a
satire on finding love on the

130.00.text:
Internet when you're 60. Then
her daughter's having a baby,

135.44.text:
her parents are dying, her
dog is dying, her husband

139.41.text:
nearly dies of an aneurism of
the aorta but recovers and

145.21.text:
she's in that place where we
are when we turn 60. People,

151.22.text:
friends are dying of breast
cancer, families are fading

155.89.text:
away, we want to be there for
our parents as we become

160.89.text:
their parents. And I wanted
very much to write a novel

165.83.text:
about what happens to women
as we get older.

172.31.text:
all of these losses says she
hates old age. You

176.41.text:
think this is true of a lot of
women in that age group?

179.78.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: I think
we go through a period where

181.35.text:
we absolutely hate getting
older. We hate it. We hate,

187.02.text:
we look in the mirror and
see our mothers face or our

190.19.text:
fathers face and we're
not happy about it.

194.06.text:
But I think when we pass 
through that rage,

197.43.text:
I call it age rage, we
come to the other side of it

201.87.text:
and we see all the wonderful
things about getting older.

206.54.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: What does
Vanessa hope to get out of

212.61.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: She hopes she
will find a lover who will

215.85.text:
satisfy her beyond
her wildest dreams.

220.92.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: And
she says early on the book that

223.62.text:
life is passion and she tends to
equate passion with sex.

227.73.text:
So is it that that she's trying
to get back into her life.

231.16.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Yes, she's
trying to get back passion and

234.10.text:
because she's an actress and
she's always been beautiful

237.44.text:
and her looks have
carried her, she cares terribly

242.91.text:
about looking older
and I am not an actress,

247.15.text:
it's true I did the Vagina
Monologues at the West Side

249.98.text:
Arts for three
weeks but I am not an actor.

255.16.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: That
qualifies you as an actress.

257.06.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: No hardly,
but you know Eve Ensler and

258.83.text:
Shirley Knight talked me into
it. And I did it and I found

262.03.text:
it very interesting, I
found waiting for the car,

266.50.text:
going to the, going to the
theater, bonding with my

270.44.text:
fellow actors, going
on stage, doing your thing,

276.68.text:
eight shows a week, very
tiring. And then it showed me

281.88.text:
a little bit about how hard
that life is. And I always

285.72.text:
wanted to write a novel in
which I used that material.

290.06.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Right. So
this is it.

295.36.text:
of making the book about a 60
year old Isadora Wing you make

300.60.text:
Isadora Vanessa's best friend.
So you get Isadora in there.

305.81.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: But
Isadora, that came very, very

307.87.text:
late and about the 10th draft
of the book, I thought you

312.08.text:
know readers are going to
want Isadora and Isadora is

315.92.text:
older and wiser and she is
and maybe she's even wiser

323.79.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Because
it seems that you know with

326.13.text:
all the stuff that Vanessa is
going through and there’s

328.90.text:
Isadora over in
the corner acting as this sort,

331.90.text:
I could think of sort of a one
woman, I don't know if it’s

334.90.text:
Greek chorus or as an omniscient
narrator saying hey do you

339.74.text:
really want to do
that, sort of a voice of reason.

343.08.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: I think
of her as Jiminy Cricket.

346.78.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: You know I think
of her as you know Pinocchio’s

352.62.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Always chirping
in his ear you know.

357.26.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: That wonderful
novel Carlo Claudius novel

359.79.text:
that became a Pinocchio
cartoon by Disney, but in the

364.33.text:
novel, the novel which I read
in Italian class was so

367.37.text:
amazing because Pinocchio is
always giving all kinds of

375.14.text:
problems to Geppetto, his
father and maker, and he

380.15.text:
represents the adolescent boy
raging against his daddy.

384.99.text:
Right. And thinking his daddy
knows nothing but Jiminy

389.39.text:
Cricket whispers in his ear
don't do that, don't lie,

394.23.text:
your nose will grow. It's a
very beautiful story.

398.06.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Was
Jiminy Cricket in the book?

400.60.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: No, Jiminy
Cricket was the cricket who

406.74.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: OK. OK. So
Walt Disney didn't invent him.

410.44.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: OK I
stand corrected. In Fear of

415.85.text:
Flying you wrote that there
were certain taboos that

418.55.text:
apply to women of Isadora’s
age. What are the taboos that

422.96.text:
apply to women of Vanessa’s
age?

425.46.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Well we're not
supposed to be sexy after

428.36.text:
60 and yet we are. We're not
supposed to want to look

433.13.text:
good or flirt after 60. And
yet we do. And I think the last

440.04.text:
taboo is the beauty
and charm of older women.

444.94.text:
You know in my life I've been
blessed to know many older women

449.22.text:
who always had a
boyfriend, always remarried,

454.19.text:
always, sometimes they had a
girlfriend but they were not

458.59.text:
done with relationships.
My mentor and

463.26.text:
muse Grace remarried when
she was oh 70 and about 50

471.10.text:
pounds overweight. How?
She was loving, she was sweet,

477.21.text:
she was caring and
she had a beautiful essence.

481.51.text:
And she was also a very
loving and welcoming person.

486.99.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: There
are however as you point out

493.36.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Who are
looking for a place to put

494.36.text:
all that sexual energy
and can't find a place.

497.20.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Can’t
find it. And many today find

500.40.text:
it with other women. And
thank the goddess that we're

505.57.text:
allowed to make partnerships
with people of our own gender

509.18.text:
if we love them. Thank the
goddess that we're allowed to

512.85.text:
marry if that is what we
wish. So I think that we've

518.22.text:
seen huge changes for older
women, huge but the culture

523.76.text: seems not to have caught up.

525.53.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Do you
think there should be safe

526.86.text:
places where 60ish women and
up can go and have their

531.30.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Well that is
Vanessa's fantasy. I don't know

536.30.text:
how we would create it but
Vanessa has this fantasy that

540.61.text:
she's going to start a
place where older women

543.48.text:
can have fabulous sex with young
studs. We don't explore

552.45.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: You wonder
why nobody has come up with

554.35.text:
that idea. It seems like it
might be a commercial success.

559.16.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: It would be but
America is a very puritanical

562.93.text:
country and it won't happen
first in America, I don't

566.63.text:
think. It might happen first
in other parts of the world.

573.24.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Maybe or
Norway or Sweden I don't

576.18.text:
know. But I have to say that
we are very backward about

583.65.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Vanessa
has had plastic surgery and you

586.32.text:
write about why so many women
in her age group have

591.69.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Well you know
when you're out there as a

595.36.text:
public figure, they don't want
you any more if you look old.

602.30.text:
That is true. And so I don't,
I'm not surprised that

608.01.text:
Barbara Walters had this
great surgery that she had

611.34.text:
many times. I'm not surprised
that people like my friend

615.68.text:
Judy Collins have had
surgery. They're performers.

619.29.text:
They have to be out there and
they want to look the best

625.26.text:
they can otherwise they don't
get booked.

627.86.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Right. So
it's about fear of abandonment

632.03.text: either by men or by you know.

637.30.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: And I think
many women do. I mean look

640.97.text:
at Jane Fonda lately, I
mean she looks phenomenal.

645.25.text:
This is a woman who has
been working out, working her

649.02.text:
little tush out for years and
years and years and it shows.

652.45.text:
She's also had surgery
but she looks beautiful.

655.86.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY:
Right, she looks good, she

657.59.text:
looks good. So as you said
Vanessa meets a number of men

660.96.text:
through zipless.com but
they are really very strange.

667.37.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: And she
and they're so strange that

669.04.text:
she doesn't have sex with any
of them in fact she, she flees

671.44.text:
from them. Do you know
women who have had experiences

674.37.text:
like this, you know seeking
partners on the internet.

680.88.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: I've
never done it myself but

683.25.text:
friends have told me stories
and I have to say quite

687.52.text:
honestly that the stories
have been horrific. Also I

691.93.text:
have an imagination and I've
had the fantasy at times of

696.60.text:
going online and then I've
thought about it and I

699.80.text:
thought what on earth are you
going to find.

706.01.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: So your
female friends who have met

709.11.text:
men, remarried in their 70s, how
did they meet them?

714.18.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: They met them,
well the best places I think to

716.95.text:
meet men are at church,
synagogue or sporting events.

726.59.text:
for me in church maybe I
should go to the synagogue.

730.06.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: No I mean because
at least you know they're

732.20.text:
not crazy. You know
they're, I mean maybe not,

737.14.text:
it depends on where. I think
a lot of women have met men

742.28.text:
online, my daughter met
her husband on JDate.

745.45.text:
But she was very young and
that was very different,

750.85.text:
she married at 25. And she
met a lovely man on JDate.

759.59.text:
But I think it's
harder when you're older.

762.23.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Yeah.
Yeah. So Isadora as we've

765.20.text:
said has gone from being a
wild girl to being a wise

768.17.text:
woman especially after her
own husband died is this

771.40.text:
something that happens to a
lot of women who may have

776.21.text:
been kind of wild and crazy
out there in the sexual

778.98.text:
revolution and but at this
age they've mellowed. I don't

784.98.text:
know they’ve been through
some stuff.

787.02.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: We
do mellow. We do mellow.

788.69.text:
And when we find love
it's a mellower kind of love.

792.46.text:
I'm sure of that.
That I've seen again and again.

797.36.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: OK. We're

799.53.text:
and then we'll be back

810.64.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY:
Welcome back to One to One.

812.41.text:
I'm Sheryl McCarthy of
the City University of New York

815.21.text:
and I'm talking with
Erica Jong. Her latest novel is

818.65.text:
Fear of Dying and it's
just been published by

821.49.text:
St. Martin's Press.
As Vanessa’s parents become,

826.56.text:
who were at one time a glamorous
show business couple become

830.20.text:
more and more debilitated.
She talks about her fear of

835.60.text:
their dying. What is it about
our parents impending death that

842.38.text:
is so frightening? And is it
about more than just losing

847.38.text:
them, the prospect
of losing them?

849.68.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Well
you're the next one on the

851.92.text:
cliff when your parents die.
And you know that, so you can

862.30.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: And it's
wonderfully liberating. You know

865.73.text:
when my mother was dying
and I give this experience to

868.63.text:
Vanessa, I would alternate
between, my mother lived to 101,

874.14.text:
I would alternate
between oh my God let her go

878.31.text:
she's not happy in this life
anymore to oh my God never

884.65.text:
let her go. And I would you
know really bounce between

890.16.text:
those two feelings. And I
give those feelings to

893.86.text:
Vanessa. I mean she, you
never want to lose your

896.80.text:
mother. She's the only mother
you've got.

899.57.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: And you
write that even though you may

902.57.text:
at some point say oh let this be
over, when your parents

906.84.text:
do die it's something that you
never really are prepared for.

911.84.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Never.
Absolutely never. And in my

914.81.text:
family they often live to be
100 and they weaken and you

920.45.text:
see it and you love them and
you want them to come back

925.16.text:
and be young again and they
can't. And then you see

933.67.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: And that's really
scary and it's terrifying

937.67.text:
really because you are on the
cliff, you are mortal.

942.78.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY:
And you're next in line.

944.11.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: You're next in
line. But then when you get

946.18.text:
past that there's a wonderful
freedom. When you've done the

951.72.text:
grieving and you've accepted
mortality then there's freedom

957.29.text:
beyond that. And I
think the freedom is wonderful.

960.83.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Vanessa
has a daughter who is

962.86.text:
pregnant and this seems to be
at least at this particular

965.80.text:
point in her daughter's
life, she seems to be a bright

968.40.text:
spot in Vanessa's story. The
suggestion is that having

974.51.text:
children, grandchildren
makes us less fearful of death.

980.01.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: For me that is
the case. I don't think

982.75.text:
everyone has to have children.
I think some people long

987.19.text:
for them and feel they must
have at least one child.

991.86.text:
There are so many
children on this planet who

995.03.text:
need guidance, care, love
that I don't think everybody

1000.90.text:
needs a biological child.
Maybe we all need connections

1005.20.text:
with children. And that can
be so wonderful.

1010.44.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: But is it
the idea that I'm leaving

1014.55.text:
something behind, I'm not
going to be totally gone.

1016.88.text:
Is that what the children,
grandchildren thing is about.

1020.12.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Yes, but it's a
delusion because they're

1022.29.text:
really not us and they have

1027.03.text:
You know totally. My eldest
grandson says to me Grandma

1031.60.text:
I've decided I will celebrate

1038.91.text:
Christmas and Chinese New

1050.45.text:
Vanessa’s husband Asher who is
a billionaire I need to say,

1054.85.text:
has an aneurism, comes very
close to dying but then recovers

1060.19.text:
but after recovery
he has sexual, he's impotent.

1063.76.text:
Is this a situation that many
married women of Vanessa's

1071.30.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Many, many,
many, more than would ever

1074.57.text:
tell you. And I think that
it's very important to know

1078.81.text:
that sex is not only the
penis. And if I had one piece

1086.29.text:
of advice to give to older
men it would be you are not

1090.32.text:
your penis. You are a person,
you have hands and a tongue

1096.26.text:
and all kinds of things to
make love with do not think your

1101.13.text:
manhood is gone because your
penis is not as hard as it was

1105.54.text:
when you were 20. And
I really think that's

1110.68.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: Speaking
of penises, Vanessa or

1115.28.text:
maybe it’s Isadora make some
interesting statements in the

1117.68.text:
course of the book.
And one of them comes after the

1120.52.text:
circumcision of Vanessa’s
grandson and she says that

1125.99.text:
she feels that all of
the psychological troubles of

1128.83.text:
Jewish men's stems from their
having been circumcised.

1132.37.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Oh god this is
something my daughter doesn't

1135.60.text:
want me ever to talk about
but if you think about the

1139.94.text:
circumcision ritual,
I've always thought it was some

1145.14.text:
kind of remnant of human

1151.15.text:
older men standing over you
and saying next

1154.69.text:
time Boychuk will take the whole
thing but I'm not supposed

1160.39.text:
to say this particularly on

1165.46.text:
know it is considered a

1171.20.text:
And I'm such a bad Jew that I

1176.24.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: But what is
this about having gone through

1178.48.text:
this that you think affects
them. You seem to suggest that

1182.68.text:
they forever after they have
that obsession with that organ.

1187.19.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Well
you might say that's true.

1190.99.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: I don't think
you have to be Jewish to have

1192.83.text:
an obsession. I mean I think

1197.36.text:
much too obsessed

1203.34.text:
>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY: All right.
Vanessa talks about

1206.67.text:
experiencing a loss of faith,
I mean faced with all

1210.01.text:
of these other
losses in her life she talks

1212.61.text:
about experiencing a loss of
faith, the sense of

1215.08.text:
helplessness I believe it

1218.48.text:
dying when she says how shall

1225.29.text:
this is a common experience

>>>ERICA JONG: I do, I do. I

1232.33.text:

would have comfort. I do
believe in the life force,

1243.61.text:
I do believe in the force that

1247.98.text:
the flower as Dylan Thomas

1251.65.text:
great life force which is

1258.19.text:
I don't think that spiritual

1261.09.text:
I don't think it manifests

1268.23.text:
does manifest itself for me

>>>SHERYL MCCARTHY:
But it’s not someone who can

1275.91.text:
>>>ERICA JONG: Right. I wish

1282.72.text:

creatures. Few
